howToPlay.title: How To Play Fantasy Cricket
howToPlay.subtitle: Master the art of fantasy cricket with our comprehensive guide. Learn the rules, scoring system, and strategies to build winning teams.

step1.title: Step 1: Create Your Account
step1.desc: Sign up with your email and password. Verify your age (18+) and select your state. Your account is instantly ready to play!

step2.title: Step 2: Browse & Select a Match
step2.desc: Browse available cricket matches (T20, ODI, Test). Check match details, teams, and deadlines. Select the match you want to play.

step3.title: Step 3: Build Your Fantasy Team
step3.desc: Select 11 players within your 100-credit budget. Choose batsmen, bowlers, all-rounders, and wicket-keepers strategically.

step4.title: Step 4: Submit Your Team
step4.desc: Verify your team composition and submit before the match deadline. Your team is locked and ready to compete.

step5.title: Step 5: Track Performance & Compete
step5.desc: Watch live updates as your players score points. Track your position on the leaderboard and compete with other players.

scoringSystem.title: Detailed Scoring System
scoringSystem.intro: Points are awarded based on real match performance. Here's how scoring works:

batting.title: Batting Scoring
batting.intro: Batsmen earn points for runs and other achievements:
batting.boundary: 1 bonus point for hitting a boundary (4 runs)
batting.six: 2 bonus points for hitting a six
batting.duck: -1 point for getting out without scoring

bowling.title: Bowling Scoring
bowling.intro: Bowlers earn points for wickets and economy:
bowling.economy: Economy bonus: 4 points if economy rate is under 5
bowling.maiden: 1 point for bowling a maiden over

fielding.title: Fielding Scoring
fielding.intro: Fielders earn points for catches and run-outs:

playerRoles.title: Understanding Player Roles
playerRoles.intro: Each player has a specific role. Understanding these roles helps you build balanced teams:

batsman.title: Batsmen (BAT)
batsman.desc: Primary role is to score runs. They bat first and accumulate points through runs, boundaries, and sixes. Essential for any team.

bowler.title: Bowlers (BOWL)
bowler.desc: Primary role is to take wickets. They earn points for wickets taken and economical bowling. Critical for restricting opposition.

allRounder.title: All-Rounders (AR)
allRounder.desc: Can both bat and bowl. Valuable players who contribute points in both batting and bowling. Flexible team members.

wicketKeeper.title: Wicket-Keepers (WK)
wicketKeeper.desc: Bat and keep wickets. Earn points for batting, catches, stumpings, and run-outs. Usually good batsmen too.

tip1.title: Balance Your Team
tip1.desc: Don't spend all credits on star players. Balance your team with a mix of experienced and emerging players.

tip2.title: Check Recent Form
tip2.desc: Look at players' recent performances. In-form players are more likely to score points.

tip3.title: Consider Pitch Conditions
tip3.desc: Different pitches favor different players. Batting-friendly pitches favor batsmen; bowling-friendly favor bowlers.

tip4.title: Diversify Your Selections
tip4.desc: Don't pick too many players from one team. Spread your selections across multiple teams for balanced risk.

tip5.title: Monitor Weather
tip5.desc: Weather can affect match conditions. Check weather forecasts before finalizing your team.

tip6.title: Captain Selection Matters
tip6.desc: Your captain's points are multiplied by 2x. Choose a reliable player who's likely to score consistently.

teamComposition.title: Team Composition
teamComposition.rule2: Maximum 7 players from one real-world team

creditBudget.title: Credit Budget
creditBudget.rule2: Each player has a credit cost

captainSelection.title: Captain & Vice-Captain
captainSelection.rule3: Captain and vice-captain must be different players
captainSelection.rule4: Captain must be in your final 11

deadlines.title: Match Deadlines
deadlines.rule1: Team must be submitted before match starts

scoring.title: Scoring Rules
scoring.rule2: Points are based on official match data
scoring.rule3: Disputed decisions follow official cricket rules
